WorkItem.Description:
I am having an issue with the typescript visual studio plugin.

I have a javascript project with about 4000 LoC spread across 15 files that I have converted to use typescript, but when I open it in visual studio I am not getting any intellisense, and the IDE is very slow - sometimes taking several seconds just to respond to keyboard input. The drop down menus at the top of the editor also just show "Refreshing..." (see attached screenshot).

On a couple occasions I have gotten an error in VS2012 that generated the following exception in ActivityLog.xml:
```
System.ArgumentException: Value "C:/fakepath/Scripts/application-shell.ts" is invalid for the 'fileName' parameter: the value must should not contain '/' characters Parameter name: C:/fakepath/Scripts/application-shell.ts at 
TypeScriptLanguageService.ScriptContext.FileNameScriptId..ctor(String fileName) at 
TypeScriptLanguageService.ScriptContext.FileNameScriptId.CreateFileScriptId(String fileName) at 
TypeScriptLanguageService.ScriptContext.KnownBuffersCollection.CollectBuffersFromRunningDocumentTable() at TypeScriptLanguageService.ScriptContext.KnownBuffersCollection.get_Buffers() at 
TypeScriptLanguageService.ScriptContext.DefaultScriptContextProvider.RefreshOpenDocumentList(Action callback, Nullable`1 delay) at 
TypeScriptLanguageService.ScriptContext.DefaultScriptContextProvider.OnTextViewClosed(ITextView textView) at TypeScriptLanguageService.ScriptContext.VsTextViewCreationListener.<>c__DisplayClass2.<VsTextViewCreated>b__1(Object sender, EventArgs e) at 
Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Utilities.GuardedOperations.RaiseEvent(Object sender, EventHandler eventHandlers)
```

And here is the xml in the csproj file for the file causing an error:
```
    <TypeScriptCompile Include="Scripts\application-shell.ts" />
    <EmbeddedResource Include="Scripts\application-shell.js">
      <DependentUpon>application-shell.ts</DependentUpon>
    </EmbeddedResource>
```
There are several other typescript files in the Scripts folder - but only this one is causing an error. I am also able to compile using the typescript compiler just fine - just the editor is causing problems.

I don't know if this is related to the lack of intellisense, but If I create a new typescript project and add a few files, everything still works fine, and I don't get this error.

Are these two issues related? Or is there another problem I need to fix to get intellisense back? Is there more information I can supply? I am using version 0.8.3.1 of typescript and have tried reinstalling it.
WorkItem.Summary: Typescript intellisense not working, and IDE is very slow in VS2012

Comments.Message:
No, removing the file from the project did not help. The project is just a generic c# project, the js files generated by tsc are included as embedded resources (changing them from EmbeddedResources to Content didn't help either).

I did manage to fix the issue by removing all of the .ts files from the folder (but not the project), and then re-adding them one-by-one. I have no idea why this fixed the issue, I will add more information if I run into it again and can come up with better repro steps.
